text:
ARIZONA STATE COLLEGE
TEMPE
July 29, 1957
NAEB Headquarters
Educational TV Research Dept.
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Gentlemen:
Some time ago we received from your organization the list
of the "Fact Sheets" that the NAEB had distributed during the
preceding year.
In checking our files, we discover that some of our "Fact
Sheets" have not been filed properly, and hence, have disappeared.
We are wondering if it would be possible for you to send us
copies of the following:
SERIES I:
16. Reprint of a review of The American Psychologist as
distributed with the NAlflS Newsletter of December, 1955.
17. INCREASED PRODUCTIVITY MADE POSSIBLE BY TELEVISION IN
EXTENSION WORK
1#. Penn State TV Research Project (1955).
V?. LEARNING AND ATTITUDE CHANGES RESULTING FROM VIEWING A
TELEVISION SERIES, * BON VOYAGE*.
26. TELEVISION AS A TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL MEDIUM
SERIES II
6. Reprint From NAEB Newsletter of February, 1956: BBC
Further Education Experiment.
If. FACTORS LEADING TO EFFECTIVE TELEVISION INSTRUCTION.
PROCEDURES FOR IMPROVING TELEVISION INSTRUCTION.
/ SERIES IV
10. BENCHMARK TELEVISION - RADIO STUDY, Part I: LANSING
SERIES VI:
5. Tffi "TELEVISION RADIO AUDIENCE AND RELIGION.
